author: hwright
msg: Some followup fixes to r33730.
Suggested by: gstein
* subversion/libsvn_fs_base/bdb/dbt.c
(svn_fs_base__str_to_dbt): Simplify checksum size calculation.
* subversion/libsvn_fs_base/dag.c
(svn_fs_base__dag_set_proplist): Fix comment.  Also, simplify error
checking.
(svn_fs_base__dag_finalize_edits): Simplify error checking.
* subversion/include/svn_error_codes.h
(SVN_ERR_FS_NO_SUCH_CHECKSUM_REP): Change category offset.

author: kameshj
msg: Delete http://svn.collab.net/repos/svn/branches/1.5.x-r32968

author: kameshj
msg: Merge r32968, r32975 from backport branch 1.5.x-r32968.
Fix bug which occurs when a merge adds explicit mergeinfo to a subtree that
had no explicit mergeinfo prior to the merge.  This new mergeinfo could
obstruct any mergeinfo the path previously inherited and the new path
was not getting mergeinfo set that described the merge itself -- See
http://subversion.tigris.org/servlets/ReadMsg?listName=dev&msgNo=142460.
Notes:
r32968 is a new test for this problem and r32975 is the fix.  When merging
these changes there are some minor conflicts...Minor but sufficiently
annoying to disuade review, hence the backport branch 1.5.x-r32968.
Justification:
Incorrect mergeinfo results when this bug is encountered and it has
already been encountered in our own repository as described in the
aforementioned thread.
Votes:
+1: pburba, rhuijben, kameshj
+0: arfrever

author: kameshj
msg: Revert r33796 as it causes compile failure due to missing 'SVN_ERR_ASSERT'

author: gstein
msg: Remove some path-accessing functions in favor of stream-accessing
functions in the add_file_with_history() function. A bunch of other stream
copies were simplified by using the new copy3() variant.
Note: a somewhat unrelated change is that the code longer bothers to copy
permission flags onto things being placed into the temp area or text base.
This code (rightly) assumes that the perms will be set properly when the
file is installed into ACTUAL.
* subversion/libsvn_wc/update_editor.c:
(add_file_with_history): use svn_stream_open_unique() to place a file
that contains the text base of the file being copied (instead of
svn_wc_create_tmp_file2). use get_revert_contents or
get_pristine_contents to get a source stream, instead of their path-
based equivalents, then use copy3() to copy their contents over.
When fetching from the repository, simplify all of the logic -- we
already have a target stream to write into.
(close_file): simplify code by using svn_stream_copy3(). no longer copy
permissions from the copied text base to the new text base.
(svn_wc_add_repos_file3): simplify by using copy3()
